poem:
**Shadow Fleet**

In morning's whisper, tankers loom,  
Steel giants harbored in salt's bloom.  
French boots clang on russet decks,  
Where skylines bruised by drones perplex.  
Oil coats the tale, shadows spill—  
Ghosts glide where mists conceal.  
A ballet adrift, underwatch eyes,  
In twilight's murmur, truth denies.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "French forces board Russian tanker suspected of drone launches – as it happened 6.37pm BST Closing summary … and on that note, it’s a wrap! French military personnel were reportedly on the deck of a tanker alleged to be from Russia’s “shadow fleet” stationed off France and suspected of involvement in drone flights over Denmark last month (13:22, 18:51, 17:17). Related: French military boards Russia-linked oil tanker suspected of launching drones Elsewhere, Top European leaders". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: French forces board Russian tanker suspected of drone launches – as it happened 6.37pm BST Closing summary … and on that note, it’s a wrap!
